February 19/ 1963
Res NAEB Region XI Meeting
Tampa, March 29-30, 1963
and Members of Rgidio Panel (Mar. 29)
Graydon Ausmus
Haskell Boyter
Dick Hull
9c. Kenneth Wright, Chairman Ed Burrows
Dear Kens
This is to suggest topics which seem to me to need discussing by
the radio fraternity at Tampa. I'm sure neither you nor the other
members of the panel need such a list but to the extent this may
reinforce or contradict your own views of what might usefully be
discussed, it may be of some help. If you will distill an agenda
from these and your own ideas, Ken; and from suggestions from the
other members of the panel, which 1 hereby request they send you,
1 think we will have more than we can handle both Friday afternoon
and Saturday morning. In order to provide every opportunity for
informal as well as formal discussion, I 11 be sending out a notice
shortly, as 1 indicated to you, setting a place for early arrivals
to get together Friday morning to talk radio. I plan also a post¬
banquet get- ogether about which more later.
X intend for the Saturday morning group to comprise a caucus of the
whole for the purpose of making some specific long range plans and
recommendations. Xt would help to have soundings on these matters
from your Friday session. By these matters , 1 nave in minds
WORKSHOPS
The need for workshops in production, in music, in pro¬
gramming, in financing, in promotion, in program sources
and program exchange. It is a tired thing to say, but
there is not enough time at these quickie regionals. The
question that needs settling is how we do this* by
extending the length of the regional meeting? perhaps by
scheduling it at and holding it in a resort
area? or by scheduling these workshops individually as
Region XXX did in the case of music?
